src.engineer package¶

Submodules¶

src.engineer.engineer module¶

class src.engineer.engineer.Engineer(name: str, data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: object

The engineer is responsible for taking all the data from the preprocessors, and saving a single training netcdf file to be ingested by machine learning models.

Training and test sets are defined here, to ensure different machine learning models have access to the same data.

data_folder: Path, default: Path(‘data’)

The location of the data folder.

calculate_normalization_values(x_data: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset) → None¶
engineer(test_year: Union[int, List[int]], target_variable: str = 'VHI', pred_months: int = 12, expected_length: Optional[int] = 12)¶

Take all the preprocessed data generated by the preprocessing classes, and turn it into a single training file to be ingested by the machine learning models.

test_year: Union[int, List[int]]

Data to be used for testing. No data earlier than the earliest test year will be used for training. If a list is passed, a file for each year will be saved.

target_variable: str = ‘VHI’

The variable to be predicted. Only this variable will be saved in the test netcdf files

pred_months: int = 12

The amount of months of data to feed as input to the model for it to make its prediction

expected_length: Optional[int] = 12

The expected length of the x data along its time-dimension. If this is not None and an x array has a different time dimension size, the array is ignored. This differs from pred_months if the preprocessors are run with a time granularity different from ‘M’

static get_datetime(time: numpy.datetime64) → datetime.date¶
static make_fill_value_dataset(ds: Union[xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray], fill_value: Union[int, float] = -9999.0) → Union[xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray]¶
static make_nan_dataset(ds: Union[xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray]) → Union[xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray]¶
stratify_xy(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, year: int, target_variable: str, target_month: int, pred_months: int, expected_length: Optional[int]) → Tuple[Optional[Dict[str, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]], datetime.date]¶

src.engineer.nowcast module¶

class src.engineer.nowcast.NowcastEngineer(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.engineer.engineer.Engineer

Engineer the preprocessed .nc files into /train, /test {x, y}.nc for the nowcast experiment.

This takes all non_target variables UP TO the target timestep and the target variables for all previous timesteps (not the target timestep).

This produces a dataset:
P V P V P V P | V
V

Where P is the non_target_variable and V is the target_variable. t=0 is the target_timestep.

stratify_xy(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, year: int, target_variable: str, target_month: int, pred_months: int, expected_length: Optional[int] = 11) → Tuple[Optional[Dict[str, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]], datetime.date]¶
The nowcasting experiment has different lengths for the

target variable vs. the non_target variables.

e.g. if I set the pred_months = 11

x_target_variable = 11 timesteps x_non_target_variable = 12 timesteps (pred_months + 1).

We overcome this by creating an extra timestep with all nan values in the x_dataset. This way the x_dataset contains the y_dataset timestep but the target_variable is an array of all np.nan for that target timestep. This prevents model leakage.

src.engineer.one_month_forecast module¶

class src.engineer.one_month_forecast.OneMonthForecastEngineer(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.engineer.engineer.Engineer

static stratify_xy(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, year: int, target_variable: str, target_month: int, pred_months: int = 11, expected_length: Optional[int] = 11) → Tuple[Optional[Dict[str, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]], datetime.date]¶

Note: expected_length should be the same as pred_months when the timesteps are monthly, but should be more if the timesteps are at shorter resolution than monthly.

Module contents¶

class src.engineer.NowcastEngineer(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.engineer.engineer.Engineer

Engineer the preprocessed .nc files into /train, /test {x, y}.nc for the nowcast experiment.

This takes all non_target variables UP TO the target timestep and the target variables for all previous timesteps (not the target timestep).

This produces a dataset:
P V P V P V P | V
V

Where P is the non_target_variable and V is the target_variable. t=0 is the target_timestep.

stratify_xy(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, year: int, target_variable: str, target_month: int, pred_months: int, expected_length: Optional[int] = 11) → Tuple[Optional[Dict[str, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]], datetime.date]¶
The nowcasting experiment has different lengths for the

target variable vs. the non_target variables.

e.g. if I set the pred_months = 11

x_target_variable = 11 timesteps x_non_target_variable = 12 timesteps (pred_months + 1).

We overcome this by creating an extra timestep with all nan values in the x_dataset. This way the x_dataset contains the y_dataset timestep but the target_variable is an array of all np.nan for that target timestep. This prevents model leakage.

class src.engineer.OneMonthForecastEngineer(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.engineer.engineer.Engineer

static stratify_xy(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, year: int, target_variable: str, target_month: int, pred_months: int = 11, expected_length: Optional[int] = 11) → Tuple[Optional[Dict[str, xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]], datetime.date]¶

Note: expected_length should be the same as pred_months when the timesteps are monthly, but should be more if the timesteps are at shorter resolution than monthly.
